intro: Gonolobus unifarius, commonly known as the single-flowered goonib, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, solitary yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Gonolobus unifarius is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional Aboriginal medicine.
